history.proof: intros Hf1 Hf2. unfold monotone. intros x y Hxy. rewrite compA. apply Hf1. apply Hf2. apply Hxy.

chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof starting with "```coq
", ending with "Qed.```", without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Solve This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
T3: poset
T2: poset
T1: poset
f1: T2 -> T1
f2: T3 -> T2

Goal:
monotone f1 -> monotone f2 -> monotone (f1 \o f2)

Premises:
monotone : forall T1 T2 : poset, (T1 -> T2) -> Prop
Sub : forall x : ?T, ?P x -> ?sT where ?T : [T1 : poset T2 : poset T3 : poset f1 : T2 -> T1 f2 : T3 -> T2 |- Type] ?P : [T1 : poset T2 : poset T3 : poset f1 : T2 -> T1 f2 : T3 -> T2 |- pred ?T] ?sT : [T1 : poset T2 : poset T3 : poset f1 : T2 -> T1 f2 : T3 -> T2 |- subType ?P]
map_comp : forall (T1 T2 T3 : Type) (f1 : T2 -> T3) (f2 : T1 -> T2) (s : seq T1), [seq (f1 \o f2) i | i <- s] = [seq f1 i | i <- [seq f2 i | i <- s]]
fext : forall (A : Type) (B : A -> Type) (f1 f2 : forall x : A, B x), (forall x : A, f1 x = f2 x) -> f1 = f2
phant_id : forall T1 T2 : Type, T1 -> T2 -> Prop
tarski_lfp_fixed : forall (T : lattice) (f : T -> T), monotone f -> f (tarski_lfp f) = tarski_lfp f
tarski_gfp_fixed : forall (T : lattice) (f : T -> T), monotone f -> f (tarski_gfp f) = tarski_gfp f
ImageIm : forall (A B C : Type) (f1 : B -> C) (f2 : A -> B) (X : Pred A), [Image f1 i | i <- [Image f2 i | i <- X]] =p [Image (f1 \o f2) i | i <- X]
map = fun (T1 T2 : Type) (f : T1 -> T2) => fix map (s : seq T1) : seq T2 := match s with | [::] => [::] | x :: s' => f x :: map s' end : forall T1 T2 : Type, (T1 -> T2) -> seq T1 -> seq T2 Arguments map {T1 T2}%type_scope _%function_scope _%seq_scope
const_mono = fun (T1 T2 : poset) (y : T2) (x y0 : T1) => fun=> poset_refl y : forall (T1 T2 : poset) (y : T2), monotone (fun=> y) Arguments const_mono {T1 T2 y}
id_mono = fun (T : poset) (x y : T) => id : forall T : poset, monotone id Arguments id_mono {T}
compA : forall (A B C D : Type) (h : A -> B) (g : B -> C) (f : C -> D), (f \o g) \o h = f \o (g \o h)
can_comp : forall (A B C : Type) (f : B -> A) (h : C -> B) (f' : A -> B) (h' : B -> C), cancel f f' -> cancel h h' -> cancel (f \o h) (h' \o f')
eq_comp : forall (A B C : Type) (f f' : B -> A) (g g' : C -> B), f =1 f' -> g =1 g' -> f \o g =1 f' \o g'
bij_comp : forall (A B C : Type) (f : B -> A) (h : C -> B), bijective f -> bijective h -> bijective (f \o h)
inj_comp : forall (A B C : Type) (f : B -> A) (h : C -> B), injective f -> injective h -> injective (f \o h)
inj_compr : forall (A B C : Type) (f : B -> A) (h : C -> B), injective (f \o h) -> injective h
ssr.ssrfun.inj_compr : forall (A B C : Type) (f : B -> A) (h : C -> B), injective (f \o h) -> injective h
pcan_pcomp : forall (A B C : Type) (f : B -> A) (h : C -> B) (f' : A -> option B) (h' : B -> option C), pcancel f f' -> pcancel h h' -> pcancel (f \o h) (pcomp h' f')
invariant_inj : forall (aT : Type) (rT1 rT2 : eqType) (f : aT -> aT) (h : rT1 -> rT2) (k : aT -> rT1), injective h -> invariant f (h \o k) =1 invariant f k
Ring_polynom.norm_subst : forall C : Type, C -> C -> (C -> C -> C) -> (C -> C -> C) -> (C -> C -> C) -> (C -> C) -> (C -> C -> bool) -> (C -> C -> C * C) -> nat -> seq (C * Ring_polynom.Mon * Ring_polynom.Pol C) -> Ring_polynom.PExpr C -> Ring_polynom.Pol C
invariant_comp : forall (aT : Type) (rT1 rT2 : eqType) (f : aT -> aT) (h : rT1 -> rT2) (k : aT -> rT1), subpred (invariant f k) (invariant f (h \o k))
Ring_polynom.mk_monpol_list : forall C : Type, C -> C -> (C -> C -> C) -> (C -> C -> C) -> (C -> C -> C) -> (C -> C) -> (C -> C -> bool) -> (C -> C -> C * C) -> seq (Ring_polynom.PExpr C * Ring_polynom.PExpr C) -> seq (C * Ring_polynom.Mon * Ring_polynom.Pol C)
Ring_polynom.Peq : forall C : Type, (C -> C -> bool) -> Ring_polynom.Pol C -> Ring_polynom.Pol C -> bool
comp1f : forall (A B : Type) (f : A -> B), f = id \o f
compf1 : forall (A B : Type) (f : A -> B), f = f \o id
pcomp : forall A B C : Type, (B -> option A) -> (C -> option B) -> C -> option A
cancel : forall rT aT : Type, (aT -> rT) -> (rT -> aT) -> Prop
eqfun : forall A B : Type, (B -> A) -> (B -> A) -> Prop
pcancel : forall rT aT : Type, (aT -> rT) -> (rT -> option aT) -> Prop
fun_leq : forall (A : Type) (B : poset), (A -> B) -> (A -> B) -> Prop

```coq
intros Hf1 Hf2.
unfold monotone.
intros x y Hxy.
rewrite compA.
apply Hf1.
apply Hf2.
exact Hxy.
Qed.
```

original: intros Hf1 Hf2. unfold monotone. intros x y Hxy. rewrite compA. apply Hf1. apply Hf2. apply Hxy.
